intro: Lebeckia subsecunda, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ice plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Lebeckia subsecunda is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and resilience.
